title: Smart Authentic Tokenized Assets
description: Counterfeit goods make up nearly 5% of almost $20 trillion USD in global trade. Assurances are needed to prove that a product is not fake.

f6_assessments.q0: Whilst this is an interesting idea, it is not clear how funding someone to another physical/NFT limited run will bring significant benefit to Cardano. This does not scale. If the proposer had a way to make a digital twin of any physical object to prove provenance that would be a different story.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal talks about something the proposer has already done and is asking for funding to make something similar (but undefined) in the future. Whilst hey can likely produce something given they already have in the past, there is no plan as to what is actually going to be done. Please provide a plan for what you are asking funding for.
f6_assessments.q2: Please provide a plan of what you intend to make with timelines so progress can be measured. More importantly please provide information on how this will scale and bring benefits to the Cardano ecosystem as a whole. Its a cool product, but you are only making a limited number. I don't think that really fits with Catalysts funding goals, unless perhaps you can explain how it will provide great marketing that can be leveraged into other things.

f6_assessments.q0: If the correct team is put together to further develop this concept, this could have a lot of success and create a lot of adoption in the crypto space. This proposal is great because it helps address the challenge, is a great concept for future use, and is a good way to put Cardano to use.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers will benefit from showing references to any of their past work of a similar scale.
f6_assessments.q2: Would you be able to break down which kind of milestones do we have (hardware, data, process), along with how you present the full idea in a business canvas model? To proceed with your project, I highly recommend analyzing why other projects have failed as well as selecting a project category that matches the unique characteristics to solve the problems presented. Overall the cost estimation seems fair but also a breakdown of costs and a more timeline view will help.

f6_assessments.q0:
This way that this proposal intends to address the challenge is presented in an obtuse and confusing manner. In one section of the proposal the author says that 20 clocks are built, so there is a working Proof of concept product. But in another section the author says that they must  "hire some kind of front-end dev or Plutus Pioneer to finish the "exchange for physical+NFT" portion of the project. " Which says the actual meta-data product is not built.  

And the proposal says that specific metadata driven products are yet to even be ideated.
f6_assessments.q1: The author is a successful and talented electrical engineer who builds "cool products" But lacks the programming background and skills to develop the meta data products that the challenge seeks to fund. Other than offering the 20 clocks already built to Dex's (I guess as novel giveaways) there is no real statement of what the proposer intends to accomplish other than to think up "cool" products and hire a dev.
f6_assessments.q2: Since the scope of the project is over 12-36 months, and the actual products that are to be developed are not even yet conceived it is impossible to audit progress or to measure the success of the proposal over the period, and success depends on hiring a dev. there is not sufficient information to measure or audit success.

f6_assessments.q0: The NFT Nixie team has addressed the challenge of how to solve real world problems using Metadata clearly by proposing to build a system linking NFT's to real world assets improving the ability of assets to be authentically verified.
f6_assessments.q1: It seems very likely that the project will be completed successfully because it is already at trial stage. It still seems unknown exactly what will be needed to have it functioning on Plutus and there is mention timeframes could be pushed back due to the global chip shortage. Taking all this into account I still expect the timeframes given to be reasonable.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no clear breakdown of how the funds will be spent or what problems might be encountered. It would be good to see more detail about the cost breakdown and the role/ launch of NFT Nixie

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal absolutely addresses the goals of the metadata challenge. The proposer has a novel solution to a very pervasive problem of counterfeiting industry, utilizing Cardano's metadata
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer clearly has the prior experience and technical know-how to deliver, based on the proposers background provided.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has provided a very details and clearly defined roadmap, making it very easy to measure the success of the proposal for the catalyst community

solution: Provide physical hardware with a cryptographic identity and "smart" functionality by creating a digital twin utilizing metadata and NFTs.
experience: Electrical engineer w/ 13yrs experience in startups & Fortune X companies designing robots, phones, cameras, sensors,and other cool hardware
